b2s_clf.utils package¶

Submodules¶

b2s_clf.utils.compressor_utils module¶

b2s_clf.utils.compressor_utils.get_apply_functions(apply_function_list)[source]¶

Imports the necessary module for each potential data set transformer stored in a list. Such models shall be among the ones present in VALID_TRANSFORMER_CLASSES. :param apply_function_list: A list containing the objects to import, represented by their actual names as strings.

Returns

An iterable that sequentially imports the needed module for each object.

b2s_clf.utils.data_frame_utils module¶

b2s_clf.utils.data_frame_utils.generate_cross_validation_batch(n_batches, signal_df, subjects_df, subject_id_column, target_variable, test_size)[source]¶

Generates an iterable of train/test samples from a given pandas.DataFrame containing at least signal and subject data. It is a lazy generator, meaning that each instance of the iterator is given by the yield method rather than storing all instances in memory and then running over them. :param n_batches: How many batches to generate. :param signal_df: pandas.DataFrame containing signal and subject data. :param subjects_df: pandas.DataFrame containing subject data, as in get_subjects_data_frame. :param subject_id_column: Column containing subject ID or naming logic. :param target_variable: Binary target variable. :param test_size: Size of test sample.

Returns

Iterable of tetrads train_sample, test_sample, train_index, test_index

b2s_clf.utils.data_frame_utils.generate_leave_one_out_batch(signal_df, subjects_df, subject_id_column, strata_column, balanced_by=None)[source]¶

Generates an iterable of has-strata/lacks-strata samples from a given pandas.DataFrame containing at least signal and subject data. It is a lazy generator, meaning that each instance of the iterator is given by the yield method rather than storing all instances in memory and then running over them. :param signal_df: pandas.DataFrame containing signal and subject data. :param subjects_df: pandas.DataFrame containing subject data, as in get_subjects_data_frame. :param subject_id_column: Column containing subject ID or naming logic. :param strata_column: Stratification variable name in signal_df. :param balanced_by: [Optional] Whether to balance outcomes by a second binary variable.

Returns

Iterable of tetrads has_strata_sample, lacks_strata_sample, has_strata_index, lacks_strata_index

b2s_clf.utils.data_frame_utils.get_balanced_sample_from_data_frame(df, balancing_variable, max_len=None)[source]¶

Generates a balanced subsample of a given pandas.DataFrame according to one binary variable. :param df: pandas.DataFrame containing some data. :param balancing_variable: Binary variable with respect to which the sampling shall be made. :param max_len: Maximum length per class in the balancing.

Returns

Balanced subsample of df.

Return type

balanced_df

b2s_clf.utils.data_frame_utils.get_strata_samples_from_data_frame(signal_df, subjects_df, subject_id_column, strata_column, strata_value, balanced_by=None)[source]¶

Generates a stratified pair of sub-samples from a data frame containing at least signal and subject data. The pair is generated in a leave-one-out fashion, with one containing only one strata and the other containing the rest. :param signal_df: pandas.DataFrame containing signal and subject data. :param subjects_df: pandas.DataFrame containing subject data, as in get_subjects_data_frame. :param subject_id_column: Column containing subject ID or naming logic. :param strata_column: Stratification variable. :param strata_value: The particular strata to be the one-left-out. :param balanced_by: Whether to balance the subsample by a second binary variable.

Returns

Subsample of df without strata_value. signal_pos: Subsample of df with only strata_value. negative_index: Indices of subject_df used to get signal_neg. positive_index: Indices of subject_df used to get signal_pos.

Return type

signal_neg

b2s_clf.utils.data_frame_utils.get_subjects_data_frame(df, subject_column_name, subject_info_columns=None)[source]¶

Extract subject data from a data frame that contains signals attached to subjects. This is useful in the event that all subjects have more than one signal referenced to them. :param df: pandas.DataFrame containing, at least, signal data and subject data. :param subject_column_name: Specific column with (unique) subject ID or naming logic. :param subject_info_columns: List of columns that contain subject info.

Returns

pandas.DataFrame with as many rows as unique subjects and those columns specified in subject_info_columns.

Return type

df_subjects

b2s_clf.utils.data_frame_utils.get_train_validation_from_data_frame(signal_df, subjects_df, subject_id_column, target_variable, test_size)[source]¶

Generates a train and validation pair from a data frame containing at least signal and subject data. :param signal_df: pandas.DataFrame containing signal and subject data. :param subjects_df: pandas.DataFrame containing subject data, as in get_subjects_data_frame. :param subject_id_column: Column containing subject ID or naming logic. :param target_variable: Binary target variable. :param test_size: Size of test sample.

Returns

Subsample of df with training data. signal_val: Subsample of df with validation data. index_fit: Indices of subject_df used to get signal_fit. index_val: Indices of subject_df used to get signal_val.

Return type

signal_fit

b2s_clf.utils.ensemble_utils module¶

b2s_clf.utils.ensemble_utils.get_classifier_objects(classifier_list)[source]¶

Imports the necessary module for each potential classifier model stored in a list. Such models shall be among the ones present in VALID_CLASSIFIER_CLASSES. :param classifier_list: A list containing the objects to import, represented by their actual names as strings.

Returns

An iterable that sequentially imports the needed module for each object.

b2s_clf.utils.experiments_utils.transform_with_encoders(df, df_fit, df_val, valid_variables, encoder_list, encoder_kwargs, encoders_input_columns, encoders_target_columns, verbose=False)[source]¶
b2s_clf.utils.experiments_utils.transform_with_normalizers(df_fit, df_val, normalizers_list, normalizers_kwargs, normalizers_input_columns, verbose=False)[source]¶

b2s_clf.utils.transformer_utils module¶

b2s_clf.utils.transformer_utils.get_transformer_objects(transformer_list)[source]¶

Imports the necessary module for each potential data set transformer stored in a list. Such models shall be among the ones present in VALID_TRANSFORMER_CLASSES. :param transformer_list: A list containing the objects to import, represented by their actual names as strings.

Returns

An iterable that sequentially imports the needed module for each object.
